snippet: A judge issued a reprimand and a threat if the city did not reach a quick agreement with the firefighters’ union over millions of dollars owed in back pay.
abstract: New Orleans Judge Kern A Reese says Mayor Mitch Landrieu will be placed under house arrest unless city can come up with plan to compensate firefighters for $75.5 million in back pay and benefits within week; pay is owed under 2014 settlement; city has appealed ruling.
lead_paragraph: A judge issued a reprimand and a threat if the city did not reach a quick agreement with the firefighters’ union over millions of dollars owed in back pay.

headline.main: New Orleans Mayor May Face House Arrest in Pay Dispute
headline.print_headline: Pay Dispute Could Bring House Arrest for Mayor
